definitions.definition: To press between two hard objects ; to squeeze so as to alter the natural shape or integrity , or to force together into a mass .
To reduce to fine particles by pounding or grinding .
To overwhelm by pressure or weight .
examples: After the corruption scandal, the opposition crushed the ruling party in the elections

definitions.definition: To do impressively well at ( sports events ; performances ; interviews ; etc.).
examples: They had a gig recently at Madison Square—totally crushed it!

definitions.definition: To overcome completely; to subdue totally.
examples: The sultan's black guard crushed every resistance bloodily.

definitions.definition: To be or become broken down or in, or pressed into a smaller volume or area , by external weight or force .
To feel infatuation or unrequited love .
To give a compressed or foreshortened appearance to.
To make certain colors so similar as to be hard to distinguish , either as a deliberate effect or as a limitation of a display .
examples: My old TV set crushes the blacks when the brightness is lowered.

main_definition: To press between two hard objects ; to squeeze so as to alter the natural shape or integrity , or to force together into a mass .
secondary_definitions: To reduce to fine particles by pounding or grinding .
( figurative ) To overwhelm by pressure or weight .
( figurative , colloquial ) To do impressively well at ( sports events ; performances ; interviews ; etc.).
To overcome completely; to subdue totally.
( intransitive ) To be or become broken down or in, or pressed into a smaller volume or area , by external weight or force .
( intransitive , transitive ) To feel infatuation or unrequited love .
( film , television ) To give a compressed or foreshortened appearance to.
( transitive , television ) To make certain colors so similar as to be hard to distinguish , either as a deliberate effect or as a limitation of a display .
